intro: Konantzia minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered konantzia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It is characterized by its tiny, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and grows in dry, rocky habitats. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it adapts to low moisture conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
